description.content: Defines the HTTP method to be used, such as GET, POST, PUT, or DELETE.

documentation.content: Specifies the request method that determines the type of HTTP operation to perform.

description.content: A collection of key-value pairs containing additional request metadata.

documentation.content: Optional headers that can define content type, authorization, cookies, caching policies, and more.

description.content: The target URL to which the HTTP request will be sent.

documentation.content: Specifies the endpoint address, including protocol, host, path, and query parameters, where the request is directed.

description.content: The data to include in the body of the request, typically used with methods like POST or PUT.

documentation.content: Contains the request payload, such as JSON, XML, form data, or binary content, depending on the Content-Type header.

description.content: Constructs an HTTP request object using the specified method, headers, URL, and payload.

documentation.content: Generates an HTTP request object that can be sent to a server. The request includes an HTTP method, optional headers, a destination URL, and an optional request body.
